result.execSummary:
The defendant Eric Valadez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program (CIP)
IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program
--------------------------------------
If the defendant's probation is revoked, the conditions of Extended Supervision shall remain the same as the conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for one (1) year.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
--------------------------------------

Not to possess any weapons or ammunitions.
---------------------------------------

No gang contact. No contact with Blake Kruizenga. Not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia.
--------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. 
Any other counseling as recommended by the Agent. Any other conditions the Agent requires. 
---------------------------------

Defendant Eric  Valadez in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Spanish Interpreter, Bruce Goodman appeared with the defendant's mother. Court in session @ 9:03 a.m. Appearances made. Matter before the Court for sentencing. Court makes a record as to sentencing, history of the case, and PSI report. Court addresses Atty. May as to PSI and if she has reviewed the report with the defendant, does not object to the report, and has no corrections/additions to the PSI. Court addresses State as to victims.
9:06 a.m. - Statement by Defendant's mother, Maria Valadez
9:10 a.m. - Statement made by Defendant's girlfriend, Megan Harris. Ms. Harris responds to questions of Atty. May. Ms. Harris responds to questions by ADA Johnson
9:13 a.m. - Argument by ADA Johnson who is not making a specific recommendation. State refers to Exhibits #1 & #2 (previously marked - photos), in her argument. ADA Johnson responds to Court's questions.
9:21 a.m. - Argument by Atty. May
9:34 a.m. - Defendant makes a statement to the Court. Defendant responds to Court's questions.
9:39 a.m. - Court makes a record as to maximum penalties, sentencing factors, sentencing objectives, and pronounces sentence as follows:
Two (2) years of Initial Confinement followed by Two (2) years Extended Supervision for a total of Four (4) years.
IMPOSED AND STAYED AND PLACED ON PROBATION FOR THREE (3) YEARS WITH THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:


*Three (3) months in the Walworth County Jail with Work Release privileges to commence forthwith.
*Pay Court costs including DNA Surcharge
*Not to possess any weapons or ammunitions
*No gang contact
*No contact with Blake Kruizenga
*Not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs, or drug paraphernalia
*Any other counseling as recommended by the Agent. Any other conditions Agent requires.

**Any Deadtime credit to be confirmed by Jail records and will apply if the defendant is revoked.

Court provides firearm, voting, deportation, and body armor warnings to the Defendant. ADA Johnson supplements her record. Parties have nothing further. Court in recess @ 9:57 a.m.
Order for Defendant's Appearance at DOC for PSI Report
Defendant Eric  Valadez in court with attorney Julia Marie May.  Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Eric  Valadez in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Motion to modify bond by Atty Schwantes. Minutes filed.

Defendant Eric  Valadez in court, in custody with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter is before the Court on the Defendant's Motion to Modify Bond.  Attorney Schwantes advises that the Defendant's Uncle, Adrian Reyes, is a potential co-signer but he is not here today.  Attorney Schwantes asks that the bond be modified to have Mr. Reyes as co-signer with conditions that Mr. Valadez must reside at his Uncle's residence and maintain contact with his Probation Agent and enter the treatment program that his Agent sets up for him.  Argument by Attorney Rea opposing Defendant's motion to modify bond.  Court denies request for bond modification noting that Judge Reddy would want the co-signer present in Court so he could address him directly.  Case remains on as scheduled for status hearing on October 29, 2015 at 1:15 p.m. before Judge Reddy.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Eric Valadez in court, in custody with attorney David A Danz.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter was set for PH, but Attorney David Danz as an officer of the Court, informs the parties that there are issues with the complaint as these charges stem back from 2012 where immunity is involoved. It may be that Atty. Danz will be called as a witness in this case. He is not sure of the legal issues and whether there will be a conflict and cannot represent the defendant. Prelim will need to be reset so new counsel can be appointed. State does not object to resetting the preliminary hearing. The Defendant waives his right to a speedy prelim.  Matter set over for preliminary before Judge Koss. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
